      • addUriListeners

        void addUriListeners(java.lang.String uri,
                     java.lang.String[] sources)
        Adds the uri listeners. Convenience method to add multiple URI listeners to the same URI Example: 
                        //listeners only fire during onMessage
                websocketBean.addUriListeners("/chat.nsf*",
                [
                "/chat.nsf/listener.agent",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.py",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.rb",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.gvy",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.ssjs",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.bsh"
                ]);
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        sources - the sources

      • addUriListener

        void addUriListener(java.lang.String uri,
                    java.lang.String source,
                    java.lang.String runAsUser,
                    java.lang.String runAsPassword)
        Adds the uri listener.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        source - the source
        runAsUser - the run as user
        runAsPassword - the run as password

      • addUriListener

        void addUriListener(java.lang.String uri,
                    java.lang.String source)
        Adds the uri listener.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        source - the source

      • addUriListener

        void addUriListener(java.lang.String source)
        Adds the uri listener. When using this method the listener only listens for direct invocations of itself Example: 
                        websocketBean.addUriListener("/chat.nsf/observer.ssjs");
        will only fire when the SocketMessage is sent directly to the script's path.
        Parameters:
        source - the source

      • containsUriListener

        boolean containsUriListener(java.lang.String uri)
        Contains uri listener.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • removeUriListener

        void removeUriListener(java.lang.String source)
        Removes the uri listener.
        Parameters:
        source - the source

      • addObservers

        void addObservers(java.lang.String[] sources)
        Adds the observers. Convenience method to add multiple observers in one call Example: 
                                //assumes each script below will support all events (onMessage, onOpen, onClose, onError)
                        websocketBean.addObservers([
                        "/chat.nsf/observer.agent"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.ssjs"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.rb"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.gvy"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.py"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.bsh"]);
                
                        }
        Parameters:
        sources - the sources

      • addEventObserver

        void addEventObserver(java.lang.String source)
        Adds the event observer. Adds a single source as an observer for all events.
        Parameters:
        source - the source

      • addEventObserver

        void addEventObserver(java.lang.String function,
                      java.lang.String source)
        Adds the event observer to listen for a specific function / event (e.g. onMessage, onClose) Example using websocketBean managed bean: 
                                websocketBean.addEventObserver("onMessage","/chat.nsf/observer.ssjs");
        Parameters:
        function - the function
        source - the source

      • containsObserver

        boolean containsObserver(java.lang.String function,
                         java.lang.String source)
        Contains observer.
        Parameters:
        function - the function
        source - the source
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • removeObserver

        void removeObserver(java.lang.String function,
                    java.lang.String source)
        Removes the observer.
        Parameters:
        function - the function
        source - the source

      • addIntervaledScripts

        void addIntervaledScripts(int interval,
                          java.lang.String[] sources)
        Adds the intervaled scripts. Convenience method to register multiple intervaled scripts Example using managed bean in XPages Each script referenced below runs every 30 seconds 
                         websocketBean.addIntervaledScripts(30, [
                "/chat.nsf/interval.agent",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.py",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.rb",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.gvy",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.ssjs",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.bsh"
                ]);
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval
        sources - the sources

      • addIntervaled

        void addIntervaled(int interval,
                   java.lang.String source,
                   java.lang.String runAsUser,
                   java.lang.String runAsPassword)
        Adds the intervaled script and registers user and password to run under.
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval
        source - the source
        runAsUser - the run as user
        runAsPassword - the run as password

      • addIntervaled

        void addIntervaled(int interval,
                   java.lang.String source)
        Adds the intervaled. Example: 
                        websocketBean.addIntervaled(5, "/chat.nsf/RunEveryFiveSeconds.ssjs);
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval
        source - the source

      • removeIntervaled

        void removeIntervaled(java.lang.String source)
        Removes the intervaled.
        Parameters:
        source - the source

      • addToScriptScope

        void addToScriptScope(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.Object bean)
        Register bean with scripts. Make an object available to executing scripts on the server Note: You are responsible for creating a name/key that will not collide with other scripts
        Parameters:
        key - the key
        bean - the bean
